result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Allen Spencer

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: on Request to Appear Remotely

10:14 AM Defendant Mark Allen Spencer in court.  Attorney Megan McGee Norris appeared by video for Mark Allen Spencer.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Spencer and Norris have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive time limits - believe it will be a waiver - asks for update of the defendants address and phone number. Defendant provides contact number, not is phone. Court instructs to make sure he keeps in contact with his counsel, if PH is waived - Norris can appear via zoom but defendant must be in person. Court continues bond, sets for PH on 11/16/22 at 3:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on May 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:40 AM Defendant Mark Allen Spencer in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark Allen Spencer appeared by video means from FOSO. Spencer has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Spencer understands charges and penalties, has called SPD and does qualify but was not sure if one would be available today. Court commends defendant on that. Spencer make an argument for bond reduction. State - bond - no objections to a reduction to $1,000.00 cash. Court - bond - will reduce bond to $5000.00 signature bond with conditions of: no consumption of alcohol, upon request from law enforcement, defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine alcohol level, attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week and provide verification of attendance upon request of law enforcement or the Court, sets for AIA on 5/25/22 at 10:15 AM, defendant must appear in person.
Request a signature bond
Refused to sign. Upon request of law enforcement, must provide an evidentiary sample of breath or blood to determine alcohol level
